page.title: 01A view of East Basingstoke
page.content: { Eastern Basingstoke}is spreading over a rural area. New large{office blocks grow between feeder{roads and railway {lines. Older council and newer private {estates}provide family housing around schools and parks. The{Ring Road, dual carriageway}with great{roundabouts}provide excellent access. Outside is{open space; marshes, hill and{woodland,}under pressure from the town for{recreation. This seperates the town from{Basing. This{ancient village}is swamped with {commuters,}and{visitors}to the fine {ruins}of Basing House. Running parallel to the{A30}lies the {M3,}serving Basingstoke. Across this is a{private park}and a peaceful{farmland}area, almost {settlement}free.
